intro: Batrachium argutum, commonly known as the spiny batrachium, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various humid environments. It is often found in forest understories where it can climb towards light.
